dt: {bc}to cook by exposing to dry heat (as in an oven or before a fire) or by surrounding with hot embers, sand, or stones
{bc}to dry and parch by exposure to heat
{bc}to heat (inorganic material) with access of air and without fusing to effect change (such as expulsion of volatile matter, oxidation, or removal of sulfur from sulfide ores)
{bc}to subject to severe criticism or ridicule

dt.t: films have been {wi}roasted{/wi} by most critics

et: Middle English {it}rosten{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}rostir{/it}, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German {it}rōsten{/it} to roast
shortdef: to cook by exposing to dry heat (as in an oven or before a fire) or by surrounding with hot embers, sand, or stones
to dry and parch by exposure to heat
to heat (inorganic material) with access of air and without fusing to effect change (such as expulsion of volatile matter, oxidation, or removal of sulfur from sulfide ores)
